hints.content:
We need to know the total number of eggs on Saturday and Sunday.

![A tape diagram models that the 514 eggs on Saturday and 390 eggs on Sunday are equal to an unknown total number of eggs.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ae7cfd2c12d8b6d87e1b5c40b9559b71e0184211)

$\maroonD{514}+\blueE{390} = \purpleD{?}$

$\begin{align}
\maroonD{514}+\blueE{390} &=\maroonD{500}+\blueE{300} + \maroonD{10} + \blueE{90} + \maroonD{4} + \blueE{0} \\\\
&= 800 + 100 +4
\\\\
&=\purpleD{904}
\end{align}$

![Part 1 of 2. Place value blocks show 5 hundreds plus 3 hundreds plus 1 ten plus 9 tens plus 4 plus 0](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6380675a32530ff8e29e87e613023c015e524a07)

![Part 2 of 2 of previous image.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5cca1c32f95b1900ad3e9f917b4aa703fba00a84)
The bee laid $\purpleD{904}$ eggs in all.

question.content:
A queen bee laid $514$ eggs on Saturday and $390$ eggs on Sunday.

**How many eggs did the bee lay?**

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] eggs
